intro: Todea fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's todea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that emerge from the center of the rosette during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Todea fraseri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
